### Intro 
The SARS-COV2 genome got published in [Cell](https://www.cell.com/cell/pdf/S0092-8674(20)30406-2.pdf). Its shows the various ORFs to annotate the SARS-CoV2 genome. 
![SARS-Cov2 architecture](./images/sarscov2annotation_cell.png)
Due to the polyA tail in all of these, they should be amenable to being detected by 10x and ideally should tell you if it comes from a specific cell or from the "soup". Plug into the `soupx` workflow for now. Ideally, could use [Souporcell](https://github.com/wheaton5/souporcell) to be able to track different varients. This will need a fasta file with all the varients of all the different aviable sequences. [ ] 40hrs? Impractical for now with soo many difference sequences coming through. 
The workflow would be:
1) Create a custom genome with the mouse and virus transcripts. 
2) Find 10X data of mouse cells infected with SARS-CoV2. 
3) ???
4) Profits 

### Input data

All information obtained from [NCBI](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/genome/86693).
This is moving pretty fast. [ ] check for updates before running. 
[NC_045512.2](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/nuccore/NC_045512.2)

[GFF](https://ftp.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/genomes/all/GCF/009/858/895/GCF_009858895.2_ASM985889v3/GCF_009858895.2_ASM985889v3_genomic.gff.gz)

[Polypeptide information](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/genbank/sars-cov-2-seqs/#nucleotide-sequences) 

### GTF
make 'gtf' from the GFF using `gffread`.
```
./gffread -T ~/NGSdata/SingleCell/SARS-CoV2/GCF_009858895.2_ASM985889v3_genomic.gff -o GCF_0098895.2.gtf
```
Open the GTF and modify all the coding regions to "exon" since 10X only counts the exons. You can remove all the excess stuff if you want. It should look like this:
```
NC_045512.2	RefSeq	exon	266	21555	.	+	.	transcript_id "gene-GU280_gp01"; gene_id "gene-GU280_gp01"; gene_name "ORF1ab";
NC_045512.2	RefSeq	exon	13468	21555	.	+	.	transcript_id "gene-GU280_gp01"; gene_id "gene-GU280_gp01"; gene_name "ORF1ab";
NC_045512.2	RefSeq	exon	21563	25384	.	+	.	transcript_id "gene-GU280_gp02"; gene_id "gene-GU280_gp02"; gene_name "S";
NC_045512.2	RefSeq	exon	25393	26220	.	+	.	transcript_id "gene-GU280_gp03"; gene_id "gene-GU280_gp03"; gene_name "ORF3a";
NC_045512.2	RefSeq	exon	26245	26472	.	+	.	transcript_id "gene-GU280_gp04"; gene_id "gene-GU280_gp04"; gene_name "E";
NC_045512.2	RefSeq	exon	26523	27191	.	+	.	transcript_id "gene-GU280_gp05"; gene_id "gene-GU280_gp05"; gene_name "M";
NC_045512.2	RefSeq	exon	27202	27387	.	+	.	transcript_id "gene-GU280_gp06"; gene_id "gene-GU280_gp06"; gene_name "ORF6";
NC_045512.2	RefSeq	exon	27394	27759	.	+	.	transcript_id "gene-GU280_gp07"; gene_id "gene-GU280_gp07"; gene_name "ORF7a";
NC_045512.2	RefSeq	exon	27756	27887	.	+	.	transcript_id "gene-GU280_gp08"; gene_id "gene-GU280_gp08"; gene_name "ORF7b";
NC_045512.2	RefSeq	exon	27894	28259	.	+	.	transcript_id "gene-GU280_gp09"; gene_id "gene-GU280_gp09"; gene_name "ORF8";
NC_045512.2	RefSeq	exon	28274	29533	.	+	.	transcript_id "gene-GU280_gp10"; gene_id "gene-GU280_gp10"; gene_name "N";
NC_045512.2	RefSeq	exon	29558	29674	.	+	.	transcript_id "gene-GU280_gp11"; gene_id "gene-GU280_gp11"; gene_name "ORF10";
```
### FASTA
Prepare the FASTA file. You can either split it with the GTF locations using the `NC_045512.2.fa` as a refernce, or it's way faster to just go to IGV and copy each sequence from the ORFs in there. It should look like this:
```
>ORF1ab

>S

>ORF3a

>E
ATGTACTCATTCGTTTCGGAAGAGACAGGTACGTTAATAGTTAATAGCGTACTTCTTTTTCTTGCTTTCGTGGTATTCTTGCTAGTTACACTAGCCATCCTTACTGCGCTTCGATTGTGTGCGTACTGCTGCAATATTGTTAACGTGAGTCTTGTAAAACCTTCTTTTTACGTTTACTCTCGTGTTAAAAATCTGAATTCTTCTAGAGTTCCTGATCTTCTGGTCTAA
>M

>ORF6
ATGTTTCATCTCGTTGACTTTCAGGTTACTATAGCAGAGATATTACTAATTATTATGAGGACTTTTAAAGTTTCCATTTGGAATCTTGATTACATCATAAACCTCATAATTAAAAATTTATCTAAGTCACTAACTGAGAATAAATATTCTCAATTAGATGAAGAGCAACCAATGGAGATTGATTAA
>ORF7a

>ORF7b
ATGATTGAACTTTCATTAATTGACTTCTATTTGTGCTTTTTAGCCTTTCTGCTATTCCTTGTTTTAATTATGCTTATTATCTTTTGGTTCTCACTTGAACTGCAAGATCATAATGAAACTTGTCACGCCTAA
>ORF8

>N

>ORF10
ATGGGCTATATAAACGTTTTCGCTTTTCCGTTTACGATATATAGTCTACTCTTGTGCAGAATGAATTCTCGTAACTACATAGCACAAGTAGATGTAGTTAACTTTAATCTCACATAG
```
Convert to FASTA format.[ ] Probably a good idea to check the chracters to make sure they match the GTF.

### Append the file
Prep the input files for `mkref`as follows:
cd /home/asakuaa/verma014/NGSdata/SingleCell/reference
cat refdata-cellranger-mm10-3.0.0/genes/genes.gtf SARS-CoV2/sarscov2_temp.gtf > new_genes.gtf
cat refdata-cellranger-mm10-3.0.0/fasta/genome.fa SARS-CoV2/sarscov2_temp.fa > new_genome.fa

### mkref
run the following command to make the custom genome. 
```
cellranger mkref --genome=mm10_sarscov2 --fasta=new_genome.fa --genes=new_genes.gtf --nthreads=24 --memgb=60
```

### count
Run cellranger count ... when you have the data
